intro: Couepia impressa, commonly known as the Brazilian nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and small, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or purple. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and it is often found in dry, open habitats. Due to its toxic properties, it is important to handle the plant with care.
